title: Integrated Education on Digital Citizenship and Religious Moderation: Flipped Learning and PjBL-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and general understanding of religious diversity
context.additional_context: In a blended online/offline environment, explores the interaction between digital citizenship and religious moderation, enhancing practical competencies through social media utilization and project-based activities.

learning_goals: Learners can connect the three core principles of digital citizenship (ethics, literacy, security) to the values of religious moderation (inclusivity, critical thinking, responsibility).
Learners can critically analyze religious misinformation spread on social media and create alternative content.
Learners can design and implement projects to resolve conflicts and enhance multicultural understanding in digital spaces using flipped learning materials and PjBL (Project-Based Learning).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
